newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian TV anchor S.P. Singh dies at 49 - PTI.
newsitem.headline: Indian TV anchor S.P. Singh dies at 49 - PTI.

text.p: Surendra Pratap Singh, a leading Indian television news anchor and political commentator, died on Friday following a brain haemorrhage he suffered last week, the Press Trust of India (PTI) said.

Singh, 49, who anchored the prime-time news show "Aaj Tak" on state-run Doordarshan television, had served earlier as political editor of The Telegraph, Calcutta's leading English daily, and executive editor of Navbharat Times, a leading Hindi language newspaper.
Singh has also been an occasional movie script writer.
